Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2008 11:19AM mred7 wrote: Priz47 I had a feeling the surgeon may say that but I don't think that seems right.  I was also up walking all day and night yesterday.  Yesterday is when it started and I did do more than I was since surgery.  I don't think two days of inactivity would cause that.  I've had surgery before and this didn't happen.  I sometimes wish the doctors would take us more seriously and maybe look into our complaints rather than dismissing them.  I'll see what my doctor says today at my follow-up.  I have a feeling it will probably be the same.  Has your gone away?  Yesterday, when it started I jumped on my stationary bike for about 15 min. and then on the treadmill at a walking pace.  Still did not help.
Posts.Title: Leg pain associated w/ node removal? mred7 LML

Posts.Content: mred7 wrote: Please help...has anyone experience leg cramps after surgery?  I had a lumpectomy and node removal on Aug. 15th.  Yesterday started with leg cramps all day and now again today.  Don't know what's causing them.  Very scared since I don't have the best circulation in my legs as it is.  I've stretched them but doesn't seem to help.  I have breast cancer on the left breast and the cramps are in the right leg.  Any info. would be greatly appreciated.  I go for my follow-up visit with the surgeon this afternoon.  Dx 6/19/2008, IDC, <1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Leg pain associated w/ node removal? mred7 LML
